4-STEP PROCESS • HANDS-ON TESTING

How I test AI website builders

My testing process is designed to answer one question: What actually happens when you try to build a real website with this tool?

My testing process

1

Sign up and explore (1 hour)

I create a real account, not a demo. I explore the interface, try the AI generation features, and note my first impressions. Is it intuitive? Confusing? Overwhelming?

I document: Sign-up process, onboarding flow, initial AI generation quality, UI clarity

2

Build a real site (5-15 hours)

This is the core of my testing. I don't just poke around—I build a complete, functional website. Portfolio, e-commerce, blog—whatever the tool is designed for.

I document: AI generation quality, editing experience, template options, customization depth, every bug I hit

3

Test the limits (2-4 hours)

What happens when you push the tool? I add more pages, more content, more products. I try to export, test performance, check mobile responsiveness.

I document: PageSpeed scores, export functionality, mobile experience, performance with 15+ pages, limits and paywalls

4

Summarize findings (1 hour)

I compile everything into an honest review. What impressed me, what frustrated me, who this tool is actually for (not just "everyone!").

I document: Pros, cons, verdict, specific use cases, pricing breakdown, real examples from my testing

What I track during testing

Performance

  • • PageSpeed Insights scores
  • • Loading time with 5 pages
  • • Loading time with 20 pages
  • • Mobile performance

AI Quality

  • • Content coherence (does it make sense?)
  • • Design relevance
  • • Hallucination rate (fake features)
  • • Regeneration quality

Usability

  • • Learning curve
  • • Editor intuitiveness
  • • Template variety
  • • Customization depth

Practical Concerns

  • • Export functionality
  • • Free plan limitations
  • • Pricing transparency
  • • Support quality

How I score

My scores out of 10 are based on weighted criteria that vary by tool type:

30%
Ease of use
Learning curve, editor quality, intuitiveness
25%
Design quality
AI generation aesthetics, template variety
20%
Features
E-commerce, blogging, SEO, analytics
15%
Performance
PageSpeed, loading times, mobile scores
10%
Value
Pricing relative to features, free plan quality

Full transparency

I document everything. Screenshot every bug. Track every loading time. If a tool pays me for a placement (none do currently), I'll clearly label it as "Sponsored."

My promise:

I will never accept payment for positive reviews. I will never let affiliate relationships influence my scores. If I have an affiliate link, I'll clearly mark it.

Weekly Testing Notes

Don't pick the wrong builder

Get raw test results, honest findings, and data I never publish publicly. No affiliate spam.
